Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2010 05:07AM maryvanessa1 wrote: Hello everyone, I had a wide excision done on june 3,  the surgeon removed the size of 2 and a half golfballs,  i am healing well but my breast is still sensitive and  sore and it is now a month since the surgery.   my surgeon had wanted me to take another mammogram, which he said is routine on june 24, but i havent been able to go yet.  There is no way i can have them crush my breast right now.  On the outside ,  my breast  looks like its healing but the inside of it feels sore.  Anyone else still sore this long after the lumpectomy?? Thank u to all who reply.
Posts.Title: Normally how long can I recover from lumpectomy？ angelaju NYCntryGirl

Posts.Content: May 30, 2010 08:12AM maryvanessa1 wrote:  thanks so much for your replies and info.  cant wait for june 3 to be over with.  Then another week of waiting for final results.  ahhhh.
Posts.Title: IV sedation maryvanessa1 otter

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2010 04:08PM maryvanessa1 wrote:  HI railli,  i wish they gave me the drugs you were on,  I wouldnt mind a laugh or two!  I vomited when i woke up from the iv.  my head was swirling.. i think that was the worst part of the whole surgery!    I will be finding out my path report tomorrow june 11, hope they got it all out, my surgeon was confident he did, and  I hope i dont hear any more horrible news tomorrow. Thank u for your reply and I loved your post.
